name: XtraVaganza
description: Exclusively For School Students | Free Registration
body: XtraVaganza hosts a dynamic "Science Exhibition" tailored for students in classes 9 to 12. Participants are provided with topics and tasked with creating models that embody their ideas and showcase their creativity. These models are then brought to our college for a captivating exhibition where participants explain and showcase their creations to our coordinators and judges. This event serves as a platform for young innovators to express their scientific curiosity, ingenuity, and presentation skills. Join XtraVaganza's Science Exhibition for an inspiring showcase of student talent and innovation.

name: QuantQuest
description: Exclusively For School Students | Free Registration
body: QuantQuest invites participants to immerse themselves in the world of mathematics through an exhilarating competition. With challenges inspired by Olympiads and IQ-based problems, this event pushes contestants to showcase their problem-solving prowess. Through on-site challenges resembling Olympiad-style exams, participants have the opportunity to demonstrate their mathematical intellect and strategic thinking. Join us for QuantQuest and embark on a thrilling journey where your mathematical skills take center stage in this unique and intellectually stimulating event.
Accuracy
Precision(Time)

name: XpreXive
description: Exclusively For School Students | Free Registration
body: Express yourself with words! You will be given ideas to work with to create distinctive and inventive pieces. We would love to see entries that engage the reader with unique ideas, vivid imagery, and compelling storytelling, as well as exhibiting mastery of language and narrative style.

rules.body: Participants will be marked on content, organization of thought, delivery, voice modulation & body language.
Themes and relevant topics will be given on the spot, participants will be allowed to pick their topic only once through lottery.

name: Artistix
description: Exclusively For School Students | Free Registration
body: Let your brushes dance over the canvas! Paint your interpretation of the supplied themes. We would love to see artworks that not only demonstrate technical competence, but also communicate emotion, depth, and interpretation. Entries should be creative in their composition, color use, and overall visual impact.
Originality: Participants must create original artwork during the competition. Plagiarism or copying from existing artwork is strictly prohibited.
Adherence to Theme: Artwork must reflect the theme provided for the competition. Deviating from the theme may result in disqualification.

Respectful Content: Artwork should be appropriate for a diverse audience and should not contain offensive or explicit content. Any artwork deemed inappropriate will be disqualified from the competition.
Pencil Sketches will not be considered.

rules.body: Participants are required to bring their own art paper and necessary painting materials.
Will be announced thirty minutes prior to the event.

name: XpreXive
description: Exclusively For College Students | Free Registration
body: Express yourself with words! You will be given ideas to work with to create distinctive and inventive pieces. We would love to see entries that engage the reader with unique ideas, vivid imagery, and compelling storytelling, as well as exhibiting mastery of language and narrative style.

rules.body: Themes and relevant topics will be given on the spot, participants will be allowed to pick their topic only once through lottery.
Participants will be marked on content, organization of thought, delivery, voice modulation & body language

name: Artistix
description: Exclusively For College Students | Free Registration
body: Let your brushes dance over the canvas! Paint your interpretation of the supplied themes. We would love to see artworks that not only demonstrate technical competence, but also communicate emotion, depth, and interpretation. Entries should be creative in their composition, color use, and overall visual impact.
Originality: Participants must create original artwork during the competition. Plagiarism or copying from existing artwork is strictly prohibited.
Adherence to Theme: Artwork must reflect the theme provided for the competition. Deviating from the theme may result in disqualification.

Respectful Content: Artwork should be appropriate for a diverse audience and should not contain offensive or explicit content. Any artwork deemed inappropriate will be disqualified from the competition.
Pencil Sketches will not be considered.

rules.body: Participants are required to bring their own art paper and necessary painting materials.

name: UXplore
description: Exclusively For College Students | Registration Rs. 30 [per person]
body: Each participant receives an idea for an app screen, micro-component, or micro-interaction. This idea could be anything from a login screen to a newsfeed interaction.
Design Thinking Principles.
Component Usage.
Variable Properties.
Gesture Accessibilities.
Color Theories and Dimensions.
No usage of components from figma community
You can take inspiration from dribble or behance but no copying of designs

rules.body: Participants are required to bring their own PC and internet connection.

name: ClashDevs
description: Exclusively For College Students | Registration Rs. 30 [per person]
body: We will be providing an incomplete UI to the participants. They have to implement it with their inputs to complete the entire UI using only HTML, CSS, and Vanilla Js (No framework allowed) and deploy it on Vercel/netlify.
No use of CSS libaries
No use of JS libraries
No use of any frontend framework
Optimized & Organised CSS
Design Consistency
Web Performance
Responsiveness
Code Reusability
SEO

rules.body: Participants are required to bring their own PC and internet connection.

name: Cynox
description: Exclusively For College Students | Registration Rs. 30 [per person]
body: Capture the Flag (CTF) is an exercise in which participants attempt to find text strings, called "flags", which are secretly hidden in purposefully-vulnerable programs or websites
Participants are free to use any software or equipment of their choice (e.g. disassembler, Kali, virtual machines, pwntools...) provided it does not damage the target
Be mindful of your surroundings and of your fellow Users – your fellow Users may have a different level of comfort with respect to language and personal space
Refrain from demeaning, discriminatory or harassing behavior or speech
Ask organizers if you are in doubt
Completely handled through automated leaderboard system.
Attack any machine other than the designated ones
DoS Cynox CTF infrastructure or college
Modify the scoreboard
Intentionally prevent other teams from flagging

rules.body: Participants are required to bring their own PC and internet connection.

name: Eureka
description: Exclusively For College Students | Registration Rs. 30 [per person]
body: We have modified the generic webathon planning to a tech expo, where a product building boot camp will be organized where we will conduct workshops and a Product pitch deck battle where students will participate as a team and present us a product demo & presentation.
You must prepare your ppt before demonstrating your product.
There has to be a MVP ready for demonstration.
Revenue Generation
UX and branding
Implementation
Scalability
Future Scope
Uniqueness
Target Audience

rules.body: Participants are required to bring their own PC and internet connection.

name: TraceIt
description: Exclusively For College Students | Registration Rs. 30 [per person]
body: The journey begins on a website you control. This serves as the entry point and landing page for participants.
A trail of clues leads from one to the next in the Treasure Hunt.
There is a specific order in which you must find the clues. No team can ignore a clue.
Avoid looking for hints in restricted places.
In the unlikely event that players discover a clue belonging to a different team, they are not allowed to alter it. If this regulation is broken, the team may be disqualified.
Please put anything back if participants move something while looking for the clue.
Although each team's clues are unique and placed in various locations, they always lead to the same place—the treasure. Whichever team locates the treasure wins.
The judges' decisions are final and will be regarded as fair.
Completely based on time effcieny of the completion of hunt.

rules.body: Participants are required to bring their own PC, mobile and internet connection.

name: Entangled
description: Exclusively For College Students | Registration Rs. 30 [per person]
body: A maze solver is an autonomous robot or system designed to navigate a maze from a starting point to a predefined destination using sensors, actuators, and decision-making algorithms.
The robot must follow the design specifications provided. Any deviation from the mentioned specifications will lead to disqualification.
Robots that cause deliberate interference with other robots or damage to the field will be disqualified.
Humans that cause deliberate interference with robots or damage to the field will be disqualified.
The coach should not be involved in the launching of the robots as this may lead to disqualification.
It is expected that the aim of all teams is to play a fair and clean game.

All decisions about scoring, game play and timing are made by the juries. Teams should completely respect their vote and decisions. Members of the jury will be from different fields of the robotic science.
Based on the time which will be taken to complete the maze by the robot.

rules.body: Maze-solving robot according to our Constraints.

name: EdrenaLine
description: Exclusively For College Students | Registration Rs. 30 [per person]
body: RC race cars are vehicles that can be controlled remotely using a handheld transmitter or controller. The transmitter sends signals to the car's receiver, translating them into steering, acceleration, and braking.
This is a Circuit Racing event.
Only the marshal for that round is permitted to lift the vehicle and deposit it at the closest checkpoint behind that point in the event that it tumbles, stops, or exits the arena.
They will need to be completely remote controlled the entire time the race is running, until and until it becomes necessary to touch the vehicle.

Every time the machine needs to be lifted by the marshal, a time penalty will be imposed. There will also be a time-penalty for reverse gearing (all the details regarding the time-penalties will be disclosed on the day of the event)

There will be a time penalty each time the marshal has to raise the equipment. Reverse gearing will also result in a time penalty; full information about the time penalties will be revealed on the day of the event.
It is also forbidden for team members to purposefully harm the opponent's car. The accused team will be eliminated if proven guilty.
Based on the time which will be taken to complete the race.

rules.body: Race cars according to our Constraints.

name: SymbIoT
description: Exclusively For College Students | Registration Rs. 30 [per person]
body: Join experts and enthusiasts to explore cutting-edge AI solutions for IoT challenges, from optimizing energy consumption to enhancing security protocols.
The Problem Statement will be provided on spot, you must submit a project that is based on this.
You will have the opportunity to submit your project once the event begins; this will be your only and final submission.
You must submit original, creative ideas; any submission that is found to be plagiarized will not be accepted.

The whole Hackathon period must be used to create your hack. You can make advantage of additional publicly accessible platforms and services like Google Maps, Facebook Connect, Twitter feeds, and open source libraries.
The judges' decisions are final and will be regarded as fair.
Feasibility of the proeject
Environmental constraints
Cost effectiveness

name: Connectify
description: Exclusively For College Students | Registration Rs. 30 [per person]
body: We’ll provide circuit materials and give them generalized questions that they have to solve by using provided circuit
This will be a circuit designing round in which actual application has to be made.
You will be provided question sheets/components on the registration desk and you need to submit them back within the specified time limit.
All the components and material required for the circuit will be provided by us. List of available components will be displayed.
Power supply and other testing devices like multimeter, batteries and other tools will be made available.
All teams will be having same kit of components.
In case something got damaged you may request the organizer to replace the components/parts.
Teams should draw circuit diagram of the application depicting all the principles and theories involved in circuit as well as the working of the Application on a work Sheet.
Design of circuit.
Compactness of design.
Desired output.
Breadboard skills/neatness of the implemented
Circuit.

rules.body: No Requirement. [We’ll provide Breadboard, Jumper Wires, LEDs, and ICs].

name: FreeForm
description: Exclusively For College Students | Registration Rs. 30 [per person]
body: Tech Fiesta 24 allows you to showcase your talent on a creative stage, open exclusively for technical performers of all levels of expertise. Freecad is a computer-aided design (CAD) and drafting software application. Master the skill of creating aesthetic and pleasing visual elements and design the face of tomorrow.
Bring your own PC with FreeCAD installed
Do not copy from peers
A complete model is to be submitted according to the given problem statement
Partial judging won't be allowed
No practice runs will be provided
All designs submitted must be original works created by the participant and must not infringe on the intellectual property rights of any third party.
The final results will be based on the completeness and optimum usage of the software.
The judges' decision will be final and binding.
Originality and innovation demonstrated.
Clarity with visual appeal
Practicality and usability.

rules.body: Participants are required to bring their own PC and internet connection.

name: WordCraftique
body: Express yourself with words! You will be given ideas to work with to create distinctive and inventive pieces. We would love to see entries that engage the reader with unique ideas, vivid imagery, and compelling storytelling, as well as exhibiting mastery of language and narrative style.
Content should be original not plagiarized.
Original Work: All submissions must be original and unpublished pieces of writing created solely by the participant.
Adherence to Guidelines: Entries must adhere to the specified word limits and formatting guidelines for each category.
Respectful Content: Content must be appropriate for a diverse audience and refrain from containing offensive language, explicit content, or discriminatory themes.
Poetry(Max 20 lines)
Short Story(Max 1000 words)
Drama(Max 1000 words)
Creative Non-fiction (Max 1000 words)

rules.body: Will be announced 30 minutes prior to the event.
Paper will be provided by the college

name: Junkraft
description: Exclusively For College Students | Free Registration
body: Transform trash into treasure! Show us your creativity by transforming waste into something beautiful and functional. Entries will be evaluated based on the uniqueness of the concept, the effectiveness of the transformation, the sustainability of the materials utilized, and the overall visual appeal and utility of the completed product.

rules.body: The focus should be on artistic composition, creativity, and design.
Required waste materials should be brought by the participants.
